Introduction to ‘caracas’

Source: vignettes/introduction.Rmd
introduction.Rmd
library(caracas)

Road-map

Currently only a SymPy object is available. More functionality will be added shortly. Please keep an eye out at the development site at https://github.com/r-cas/caracas.

Notes

  • Python syntax is used, which means that there are a few differences to R’s syntax:
    • Power is ** not ^ (see below)

Quick start

x <- symbol('x')
as.character(x)
#> [1] "x"
x
#> [caracas]: x
as_r(x)
#> expression(x)
2*x
#> [caracas]: 2⋅x
y <- symbol('y')
sqrt(3*x^y)
#> [caracas]:       ____
#>                 ╱  y 
#>            √3⋅╲╱  x
z <- cos(x)^2 + sin(x)^2
z
#> [caracas]:    2         2   
#>            sin (x) + cos (x)
simplify(z)
#> [caracas]: 1
tex(z)
#> [1] "\\sin^{2}{\\left(x \\right)} + \\cos^{2}{\\left(x \\right)}"
z <- cos(x)*cos(y) - sin(x)*sin(y)
z
#> [caracas]: -sin(x)⋅sin(y) + cos(x)⋅cos(y)
simplify(z)
#> [caracas]: cos(x + y)
z <- cos(x + y)
z
#> [caracas]: cos(x + y)
expand(z)
#> [caracas]: cos(x + y)
expand_trig(z)
#> [caracas]: -sin(x)⋅sin(y) + cos(x)⋅cos(y)

Limits

x <- symbol("x")
lim(sin(x)/x, "x", 0)
#> [caracas]: 1
lim(1/x, "x", 0, dir = '+')
#> [caracas]: ∞
lim(1/x, "x", 0, dir = '-')
#> [caracas]: -∞

We can also postpone evaluation:

x <- symbol("x")
lim(sin(x)/x, "x", 0)
#> [caracas]: 1
lim(sin(x)/x, x, 0)
#> [caracas]: 1
res <- lim(sin(x)/x, "x", 0, doit = FALSE)
res
#> [caracas]:      ⎛sin(x)⎞
#>             lim ⎜──────⎟
#>            x─→0⁺⎝  x   ⎠
as.character(res)
#> [1] "Limit(sin(x)/x, x, 0)"
tex(res)
#> [1] "\\lim_{x \\to 0^+}\\left(\\frac{\\sin{\\left(x \\right)}}{x}\\right)"
doit(res)
#> [caracas]: 1
as_r(res)
#> [1] 1

Derivatives

Note that the function is called d() and not deriv().

x <- symbol("x")
y <- symbol("y")
f <- 3*x^2 + x*y^2
f
#> [caracas]:    2      2
#>            3⋅x  + x⋅y
as_r(f)
#> expression(3 * x^2 + x * y^2)
dd(f, "x")
#> [caracas]:        2
#>            6⋅x + y
dd(f, x)
#> [caracas]:        2
#>            6⋅x + y
dd(f, c("x", "y"))
#> [caracas]: ⎡       2       ⎤
#>            ⎣6⋅x + y   2⋅x⋅y⎦
dd(f, c(x, y))
#> [caracas]: ⎡       2       ⎤
#>            ⎣6⋅x + y   2⋅x⋅y⎦
f1 <- dd(f, c(x, y))
f1
#> [caracas]: ⎡       2       ⎤
#>            ⎣6⋅x + y   2⋅x⋅y⎦
as.character(f1)
#> [1] "[6*x + y^2, 2*x*y]"
as_r(f1)
#> expression(cbind(6 * x + y^2, 2 * x * y))
eval(as_r(f1), list(x = 1, y = 2))
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   10    4
dd(f1, c(x, y))
#> [caracas]: ⎡ 6   2⋅y⎤
#>            ⎢        ⎥
#>            ⎣2⋅y  2⋅x⎦
f2 <- dd2(f, c(x, y))
f2
#> [caracas]: ⎡ 6   2⋅y⎤
#>            ⎢        ⎥
#>            ⎣2⋅y  2⋅x⎦
as_r(f2)
#> expression(rbind(cbind(6, 2 * y), cbind(2 * y, 2 * x)))
eval(as_r(f2), list(x = 1, y = 2))
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]    6    4
#> [2,]    4    2
x <- symbol("x")
y <- symbol("y")
f <- eval_to_symbol("[3*x**2 + x*y**2, 2*x, 5*y]")
f
#> [caracas]: ⎡   2      2          ⎤
#>            ⎣3⋅x  + x⋅y , 2⋅x, 5⋅y⎦
dd(f, c(x, y))
#> [caracas]: ⎡       2      ⎤
#>            ⎢6⋅x + y   2  0⎥
#>            ⎢              ⎥
#>            ⎣ 2⋅x⋅y    0  5⎦

Using SymPy directly

sympy <- get_sympy()
sympy$diff("2*a*x", "x")
#> 2*a
sympy$solve("x**2 - 1", "x")
#> [[1]]
#> -1
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> 1

More examples

Please find more examples in the other vignettes.
